comment: I just took MGT 4190 as a summer course, online and loved every bit of it. Prof Xu is pretty straight forward, there are 6 chapter discussions and quizzes, 3 attempts for each quiz, 2 group projects and a final essay as your final exam. TIP: On discussions be very thorough on answers, and find group members asap!

I took this class online and it was horribly difficult to follow. She does not use any of the tools on Vista, is late updating grades, give three paragraph long weekly updates that are stuck in the discussion board, and you have to hunt for details on every assignment. Her projects are vague and uninteresting. I do not recommend this class!

This class was very easy and straight forward. There were two group projects, 10 quizzes, one individual assignment and a final exam which was an essay. This class is an easy A, I took it as a business elective. The only thing that I did not like about this professor is that she is not very involved.

Online. Every week you do 1 chapter with a quiz(you can take 3 times) and discussion board(requires 4 postings). There's also a group case analysis, a final team project and 1 individual assignment. She seems to be a pretty easy grader so far on these written assignments. Overall ok class. Material isn't complicated, everything's straight from text
Professor Xu was a great online professor...gets back quickly to questions, assignments are clear and you can take the chapter quizzes 3 times. Great experience for an online class!
Stella Sixing Xu is this professor's name. Owl Exress only lists it as Sixing Xu.
Hands down the worst teacher Ive ever had at KSU. Didnt prepare for 3200 at all. Do not take her period.

worst teacher ever.  she has no guidelines for class. She basically opens the text and asks if anybody has any questions.  she demands a lot of work for this class. online quizzes for every chapter.  She gives assignments that are so broad you have no idea what she is asking for.  Good luck if you have her

I part of a summer study abroad program headed by Stella Xu to China. Prof. Xu is usually a pleasant teacher although she occasionally becomes very rude. The class organization was extremely poor and nearly impossible to follow, the workload was ridiculously large and convoluted. I DO NOT recommend her it you're going abroad, it was nonstop stress.

Not too difficult of a class as long as some amount of effort is given.  It will make her day if someone actually participates in class without being called on (which she does do to see if you're keeping up with the reading). Take notes on the videos shown in class.  Her verbal communication skills are not strong, but getting better. Good luck!

She is the best teacher I ever had. She fill up every class with something interesting and important, you won't fill boring at all. I got an A in her class. Attandence is not mandatory as long as you have reason for her, so go for her.
